bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, May 17, 1901
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 71. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, May 17, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Acknowledged receipt of official publications May.
No. 71. Consular. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia; May 17, 1901.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of the following publications; viz., daily consular reports, notice to Mariners; Aoruk 13, 1901; Treasury Decisions; Values of foreign coins, April 1, 1901; Bills of health of vessels arriving in a District of the United States, Act of March 3, 1901; Status of Puerto Rican vessels in respect to Consular fees, April 5, 1901; Bills of health for foreign War vessels, April 6, 1901; Status of Philipines, Puerto Rican, and Cuban
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith, Consul General.
